1.content:
Deep in the darkest ruins in a cave on the top of Mount Seclier three intrepid adventurers were navigating where very few dared to tread. It had been a perilous journey exploring the ruins and if not for the fact each of them had mastered their craft they would have perished many rooms prior.

The first of them was a thief in class by the name of Jet. A master of stealth and a true professional of acquiring things that other claimed to be untouchable. Unlike many others in her profession however she had a strong moral code, refusing to harm anyone unless in danger herself and always using her talents to help those in need of them. Currently she was using her skills to return an artefact that was lost for a dear old woman down on her luck she had met at the local inn.

“Sheesh, these doors just keep getting tougher.” Taking on arm free from picking the lock she wiped the sweat from her brow and tucking her hair behind her ears. With another exhausted sigh she reached down her leather armour and pulled out a much sturdier looking lock pick. “Time to bring out old faithful, ain’t nothing been able to stump her yet” She grinned. Within mere seconds the party heard the clunk of gears as the doors separated, releasing a plume of dust from the ancient mechanism. “Bingo!” The thief beamed, turning to face the other members of her party.

The face she met with was not one of joy however. The second of the party was a magic user named Holly. She was a master of healing spells and has rescued the party from certain death more times than any of them would like to admit, she was also a dab hand at battling undead creatures thanks to her holy magic. Unfortunately for her however she was standing a bit too close to the door when it opened and was currently brushing of the flurry of dust that covered her entire body. “Awww jeeeezzzzzeee” she cutely pouted. “I knew I shouldn’t have followed you here these ruins are so icky” She huffed, stamping her foot on the ground.

“Hey, don’t be like that Holly. You know for a fact I wouldn’t want to go anywhere in the world without my best friend.” Jet said, stifling a laugh at the site of her normally meticulously dressed friend. “And besides we would have had a real tough time without your magic back there” Her pout began to slightly lift hearing Jet’s words. As much as she hated gross things being praised by Jet always made her lighten up. She was convinced Jet was also aware of this fact but as long as she was praised she didn’t really care.

“If you two love birds are finished chirping, this should be the last room” The third party member huffed, barging past Holly and knocking the crouched Jet onto the floor with a thud. “We are not love birds, Clara!” Holly squealed, her face turning redder than the ripest tomato. “Yeah, yeah let’s just get a move on”

The third party member Clara was as tough as they come, hired rouge by trade and a master of all things bladed. Very few creatures could stand up to her dual daggers and for the right amount of coin very few people could either. Unlike the Jet and Holly she was not on this quest out of the goodness in her heart, nope she had already taken all of the old woman’s valuables (Though not that many to begin with) as a deposit and was just intrigued to see this fabled artefact.

As the three of them entered the main chamber, torches held on the wall began to flicker into life. Bathed in this new light they could see the spectacle of it all. A huge dome of intricate mosaic lined the ceiling, depicting some form of deity. Only Holly seemed interested in examining this however, as the other two raced to the main altar in the middle. Jet had made it first and picked up the small locked chest, another firm shove from Clara however was more than enough to send her tumbling.

Brushing herself off, she stood up once more “Hey! What’s the big ide…” Blinding pain flashed through Jet’s nose as Clara had casually tossed the chest at her face. “Dumb things locked, open it would yah?” Jet held her tongue knowing full well from their earlier battles that she would stand no chance against Clara in a one on one fight. “Fine, but can you at least try and be a tiny bit friendlier to your fellow adventurers?” Jet sighed, reaching in once more to her leather pouch to pull out another lock pick. Clara just snorted in response her eyes transfixed on the item in Jet’s nimble fingers.

With another satisfying clunk the chest flung open and Jet plucked the artefact out. Inside was an overly ornate mirror, made of pure silver and holding a variety of different gem stones on the back in the same mosaic style as the ceiling. The front however seemed to have a very large crack through it, Jet’s reflection split in two almost straight down the middle. “Arggh dammit the mirror broke” Jet yelled “it’s still got a lot of value thanks to the frame but it would have been so much more if you hadn’t broke it” With that Clara strolled forward getting right up in the face of Jet and with a smug grin said “It wasn’t my face that bashed the mirror in the trinket box now was it? If anyone broke it, it was you master thief girl” Then in a swift motion Clara snatched the mirror. “Anyway I’ll be taking this, this quest has been far too much for the pay the old hag was offering so I’ll just sell it on some place.”

Jet couldn’t believe her ears, she knew Clara wasn’t the nicest person in the world but to steal such a treasure from an old woman was incomprehensible. “You can’t do that, she needs this to get her life back together” Jet reasoned. “She’s on her last legs as it is probably already croaked it since we’ve been here. So I don’t see the harm in making sure I get enough coin to keep me happy” Clara grinned. “I can’t let you do that” Jet warned, taking a single step forward.

11.content:
*Click* Jet’s face turned pale hearing that noise, she knew from experience that was the noise a pressure switch made when stepped on by an unaware adventurer. The chamber was suddenly filled with an ominous rumbling before a large stone boulder slammed between jet and Clara. The platform that held the altar began to rise on Clara’s side sending the boulder rolling off towards Jet. “Looks like I get to keep it after all thief girl” Clara laughed as Jet began to frantically sprint away from the accelerating mass of dense rock.

Holly how was busy studying the ruins turned her attention to the others as the room shook and was able to see the pure peril that was about to befall her best friend Jet. Thinking fast she deduced that she would not be unable to stop that boulders movement nor would she be able to get Jet free from its path. So she cast the only spell she could think of to help her friend. “Rubberfy” She screamed, casting directly onto her friend.

Jet was panicked she could feel the boulder gaining and her life began to flash before her eyes, it was then she spotted Holly in the corner casting a spell and felt a tingle flow through her body. Then she felt it, the boulder slammed into her back and then continued its momentum and rolled completely over the poor thief girl. Much to her dismay though she wasn’t dead, instead she was lifted up off the ground by the rolling stone and flattened once more as it ploughed through the corridor they had entered in.
After many different rooms spun by and she was painfully crushed over a disproportionate amount of stalagmites that seemed intent on puncturing every section of her flattened form. She realised what had happened, Holly must have cast rubberfy to give her squishable properties and save her from a messy end. This was a mixed blessing however as the boulder had made its way through the entire ruins and was now teetering on the edge of a mountain they had climbed to gain access.

Jet was squashed spread eagle and facing forwards and was able to survey the land from her precarious perch. Down below her was the village she had got the quest from in the first place as well as a forest a rocky outcrop of smaller cliffs. Jet sighed glad she was spared the rough ride down on the boulder and praying Holly would be by soon to peel her free.

A passing bird however was much too exhausted from its flight over the mountain and decided to perch itself on the rock. This simply action was all it took for the boulder to lean forward slightly and once again begin it’s terrifying decent. Jet screamed as loud as her crushed lungs would allow as she was bulldozed into the jagged rocky earth below.

The boulders decent was not as smooth as in the ruins. The rocky cliffs acting as ramps and flinging the rock high into the air before slamming down and rolling to the next one. Every now and then Jet would be unfortunate enough to be on the bottom as the boulder crashed heavily into the earth, her crushed form spread out even thinner from the immense weight.

Then came the forest, Jet would be slammed straight through the first few trees as splinters flew everywhere and dug into her already sore body. Soon the boulder slowed however and instead Jet and the boulder became like a pinball, bouncing roughly between each of the many tree trunks.

By the time they had reached the outskirts of the village the boulder had slowed to a snail’s pace. One final rotation and Jet could see the sky, then the village with many of the villagers popping their heads out to see the commotion. The boulder didn’t fully stop however as Jet could see the ground approaching one more. This ground however was coated with a thick batch razor bark thorns, known around the world for their incredibly sharp thorns. “NONONONNONONO” was all she could whimper, tears littering her eyes as she was painfully pressed into the bush and the boulder came to a complete stop.

Hours later the boulder was rolled over once more. Jet horrified that she would be sent on another hellish ride, much to her joy though she was met with Holly’s worried face. “Oh thank God you’re alive” Holly bawled. “I thought I had lost you and then I had to try and round up some people to help me and just the thought of you trapped there” Holly rambled like this for a good twenty minutes as she cast every healing spell under the sun to get Jet back to her old self.

Once finally free however Jet had only one thing on her mind. “Where is Clara?”

Option Descriptions:

North: The realm of monster girls and a very dangerous place with few and far between settlements. The terrain is very rugged with many caves, lakes and forests untouched by man.

East: The mountainous region and realm of the giantess, small people are heavily scrutinised at borders to the country and not many are allowed entry. Those that are must stick to the high walkways built for them as small people travelling on the ground will be crushed unaware by the giant women going about their day.

South: The alchemists of the swamplands live here and are constantly concocting various potions and machines in the aim of changing the world. Some of these potions can have very unpleasant side effects and the machines can be quite dangerous.

West: Mages of the desert live here and are famed for their magic. There have been a few disappearances of late but the constant trade of rare items and fancy furniture’s keep tourism booming in this hot place.

111.content:
Jet will never forget Clara’s betrayal, so the moment she caught wind she had fled north to seek a buyer in the wildlands, she was off in hot pursuit dragging behind her a very nervous if not terrified looking Holly.

Holly was always terrified of monster stories growing up so the prospect of venturing to where these stories came from shook her to the core. In truth she had every right to be scared of their destination, countless monsters, beasts and natural dangers have seen off almost everyone who dared to step foot in this God forsaken place. In fact only the most fearsome and skilled explorers could even reach the small settlements where the heroic pioneers of the time made their dwellings.

“Can’t we just wait till she comes back?” Holly trembled, her feet dragging across the mud as Jet pulled her along. “The artefact could be lost amongst merchants never to be seen again by the time she gets back. Plus I’ve told you a thousand times Holly, we’ll be fine! We just have to sneak through find the settlement, beat up that backstabber get the mirror back and then sneak home, simple!”

Holly was always bewildered by Jet’s unwavering optimism in fact it was one of the main reasons she became friends with her in the first place. “How can you say simple? We could be caught by all manner of monster before even seeing the settlement. There’s Trolls, Lamia’s, Dragons, Slimes….”

For the next forty five minutes Holly continued listing off the dangers as Jet continued to drag her along the unsteady ground.
“Ok I get it it’s a dangerous place but don’t forget you’re a top class mage and I am a master thief” Jet beamed. “Plus you can always go back if you’re that scared”

Holly swivelled in place to check the route home. The way was dark nobbled branches, poked into the barely noticeable path. The light from the midday sun was poking in just enough light to illuminate the shifting bushes that lay around her. Unfamiliar noises echoed around from seemingly all directions. Holly’s face grew paler with each passing second as she stared into that uneasy pathway. She swivels back to see Jet had strolled on ahead to scout out the land ahead. “What the hell! Wait for me, don’t leave me here” Holly cried, her steps ragged as she raced to catch up.

The intrepid duo continued pressing forward for another hour or so before their luck to a turn for the worse. With a couple gentle patters the heavens roared and a deluge of water fell from the sky.

A thoroughly soaked Holly seethed at her best friend as she fumbled about in her travellers pack for a map. “Please tell me we are close to shelter? I don’t want to be the first explorers here to be defeated by rain drops”

Using her cloak as a makeshift awning Jet unfurled the map. “Hmm let’s see, oh there is a cave about five minutes away over this ridge” Jet smiled pointing off into the distance. “That should keep us out of the rain for the night.”

“Does, this cave have a name?” Holly puzzled. “Probably, but I kind of spilt our rations over the map awhile back and some of the names are hard to make out” Jet then shot off her patented don’t hate for this smile and gave the smudge on the caves name a quick wipe with her finger before licking it off with a satisfied slurp.

“Well that’s just great so let’s head off to the mystery cave shall we? The cave of blood suckers I bet! Or maybe even the cave of cave ins. No no I bet it’s the cave of only stupid people enter here” Holly ranted stomping her feet like a tantruming toddler.

Jet put the map snuggly away into her sticky travellers pack and gave her friend the biggest hug of her life. “Look I know this isn’t ideal but don’t worry you and me have always managed to get out even the tightest of binds, so this cave isn’t going to be able to stop us.” Jet’s warm words and even warmer embrace thawed Holly’s tired and cold bones.

“Come on let’s go catch some sleep and we’ll continue the hunt for Clara in the morning first thing”

1111.content:
With a deluge of water pouring from the heavens the two friends scrambled to the maw of the cave. Looking it over it seemed quite safe, no obvious signs of monster infestation littered the entrance. There weren’t any tracks either, though the rains made looking for them a task in itself. As they pressed on the ground outside the cave was now nothing more than a thick gloopy soup of viscous mud. “Don’t worry we’ll get through this and be drying are gear in no time “Jet beamed, stretching out her limbs before blasting off in an explosive sprint.

Jet was sprinting full power with her usual vigour almost skipping effortlessly over the quagmire before her. That was until she came to the centre of the bog of course. Thanks to the heavy rain the centre of this patch had become like quicksand, Jets nimble feet effortlessly pulled into its sticky embrace. Jet began to panic as she sunk down to her waist and attempted to dig her legs free with her bare hands but no matter how much earth she shifted the rains just washed more mud to take its place.

Not wanting to let Holly realise her plan was unravelling almost as fast as she came up with it she yelled across. “Ummm Holly, I’m going to help you across ok? I know you’re not as adept at travelling rough terrain like me”

Holly simply stood there puzzled at how Jet standing in the centre of this bog was ever going to help her cross it. “How exactly?”

“It’s simple, you jump over to me and I’ll spring you with my arms over to the other side. Think of me as a bouncy stepping stone. Then once you’re across I’ll toss you my pack and then you use it to pull me to you.

Holly was truly sceptical now, sure Jet had done similar things in the past but with her current track record of bad luck things were bound to go wrong. “Are you sure about this?” Holly questioned.

“Don’t over think it just jump” Jet encouraged.

Holly paced a bit clearly worried about the best course of action before giving her cheeks a quick slap for focus and deciding to make the leap. With all her might she leapt across to where Jet was she felt as though she was flying briefly before her boots made contact with Jet. With even more force she then rocketed forward sailing past the muck and landing roughly on the cold hard rock of the cave floor. “Oh my God I did it! I did it!” she squealed hopping up and down in a cute display of accomplishment. “Jet did you see that!” her smug face dropping into one of confusion as she looked back towards Jet who was now flat on her back in the mud.

It turns out Holly did execute Jets plan to use her as a springboard but not in the way Jet was expecting. As soon as Holly had begun her sprint towards her, her boot had kicked a large wad of dirt straight into Jets face. Jet had then attempted to yell out for Holly to abort the plan but found she could only spit out mouthfuls of mud. Then as Jet had looked up to see if Holly had heard her she was met by the horrifying site of Holly’s filthy boots falling straight towards her face.

With a sickening squelch the two filthy soles squeezed a build-up of days of hiking as Holly’s full weight pressed into her. Jet’s neck bent backwards and her body sunk another foot into the goop as Jet felt Holly bend her knees and perch atop the poor woman’s face. Then with explosive force Holly kicked off to make her leap. The treads of her boots scraping painfully across Jets face, some of the mud on her soles was even scooped up into Jets nose and mouth as she bounded forward. When she was finally across Jet was left dazed and confused facing up into the rainy skies above, two perfect boot prints were left imprinted on the poor girls eyes and cheeks.

“Jet what the hell are you doing lazing about? You’ll catch your death in that rain. Throw me you pack and let’s get inside.

Jet’s world was still spinning as she tried to massage her divots out of her face and remove the last of the mud that she was forced to eat from Holly using her face as the caves welcome mat.

Once recovered however Jet threw her pack at Holly and the two began the arduous task of pulling Jet free from her sticky bind. After a good ten minutes of pulling Jet had only her ankles still trapped and she was now laying out on the surface. A few more tugs from Holly and she would be home and dry.

It was then a horrific noise filled the air, hearing this Holly dropped the pack and peered into the eerie dank cave. Deep within the sound of something truly huge began to stir from within the cave. The walls shook as its booming steps began to come closer. There was definitely something living in this cave and knowing the area it was unlikely to be friendly. “Holly quick pull me in! PULL ME IN!” Jet screamed. Holly however just stood in terror as the footsteps bounced her an inch in the air with each heavy footfall. “HOLLY FOR FUCK SAKE. PULL ME IN! “Jet pleaded.

This time Holly did snap out of it as she grabbed pack once more and began to pull. The booming steps were drawing nearer with each passing second and Holly couldn’t stand having the entrance and this creature behind her. Every few seconds she would glance over her shoulder to ensure they still had time. By now the footfalls were deafening Holly and Jet both terrified of what was going to happen.

Holly however couldn’t take the pressure anymore her flight instinct had kicked in. “I’m so sorry Jet, sorry, sorry, sorry” She sobbed as she dropped the pack and ran to a small crack in the cave wall to hide. “HOLLY COME BACK HERE! DON’T LEAVE ME!” Jet screamed.

Jet flailed desperately to get out of the sticky bog but without help she knew the odds were slim. It was then she saw a huge shadow form on the cave wall. What came into view scared her more than anything she had ever seen before. A gigantic Troll girl stumbled out from her lair brandishing a fallen tree as a makeshift torch. The creature’s size was truly colossal even by troll standards. Each of its feet could easily crush both Jet and Holly and with room to spare. It thick dumpy legs leading up to a loincloth that just covered its nethers before leading to a rotund belly that jutted out in front of it and supported its large breast covered by a similar cloth as it’s loins. Its arms were muscular and clearly strong with the ease it swung its torch. Its face was fairly plain looking the only noticeable features were two large bottom teeth that jutted up and rested either side of its large nose. The troll had even stuck its hair back into a greasy and debris ridden ponytail clearly taking some pride in its physical appearance.

Jet lay perfectly still trying desperately not to draw the creature’s attention. It lumbered about towards her, each hefty foot step closing the gap between them. Soon it was directly in front of her its gigantic knobbled toes jiggling in the mud in front of her face. The smell wafting from between its toes was enough to make Jet gag and she had to summon all of her strength not to retch and make a sound.

11113.content:
As for why Jet wasn’t instantly snatched up and swallowed by this lumbering beast, she could only deduce that it was due to trolls less than stellar eyesight. Jet’s earthen soaked body must be blending in just enough to disguise the adventurer. Now all she needed to do was wait for the beast to realise the coast is clear and trudge back into its lair then she can get Holly to pull her free and the two of them will have a long chat about not leaving friends in peril.

Unknown to the two adventures this troll was completely oblivious to the two friends hiding at the entrance to its cave, its large brown eyes casting a casual glance to where Jet was laying paralysed with fear. As far as she was concerned all she saw in front of her was a thick gloopy slop that was perfect for bathing in and that was exactly what it planned to do.

With a hefty slam it smashed its torch into the rock face of the cave entrance, ensuring it would have ample lighting while it bathed as well as allowing her to keep an eye peeled for some of the other monsters that may try and take this opportunity to steal or attack the troll. As even at its size there were other creatures here that make the troll seem more like a fairy than a giant.

This slam on the caves entrance also made Holly almost shriek as she was adamant the beast had spotted her and she had shuffled back as far as she was able just in time to avoid a tumbling of rocks that partially blocked her hiding place. After waiting a while to ensure no pudgy digits were trying to pry her from her hole Holly crept forward. With the entrance blocked all she could do now was peek outside to see where the beast had gone to and hopefully get Jet to help her free.

What she saw however made her wince in shock as its large foot was being lifted from its position and coming down squarely on top of a clearly terrified Jet, who at this point didn’t even seem to care about being spotted and was franticly clawing away at the mud as the hefty limb flattened her.

The creature then began to disrobe first removing its bra giving it a casual fling into the caves entrance and then peeling off its loin cloth. With a bend of its hips it attempted to pry it’s clothing from its body but due to the fact the cloth was countless sizes to small and the countless months that tortured piece of fabric had spent in that dank crevasse it seemed stuck firmly to its cheeks.

With a disgruntled grunt the troll began to jump in place and jiggle it’s hips in an attempt to get the fabric free. Holly may have even found the site of this semi naked creature’s display humorous if she wasn’t reminded by Jets unfortunate predicament. With each leap in the air she was able to catch glimpses of the poor girl her face itched with even more pained expressions as she was slammed face first into the thick slop. Eventually however Jet was covered up with so much muck Holly couldn’t even distinguish where on the beast foot she was adhered to.

With a large amount of effort the Troll did eventually free its loincloth and with a balance on one foot then the other it completed its removal and tossed it into the caves entrance, right in front of where Holly was hiding.

Holly almost vomited on the spot as she saw the soiled garment splayed before her, countless stains littered on literally every surface and the smell alone was enough to make one contemplate suicide. Luckily for her she was able to retreat further in and take breaths of untainted air.

For Jet however this was not the case. Her lungs have been screaming for air ever since this gigantic beast has splattered her across its foot and dumped her into the seemingly endless pool of mud. Fortunately as the troll settled into its bath and had sunk itself deep into the pool with only the top of its rotund belly poking free, she was given a brief respite. The troll had place its feet on the outskirts of the pool and the heavy rain began the task of washing the filth free.

With flattened lungs Jet tried to take in as much air as she could unsure how long she would be above ground and not under it. With every fibre of her being she willed her body to reform, desperate to free herself from the unwitting clutches of her captor but as if in response to this the troll lifted her other foot and absent mindedly scratched Jets spot with her thick yellow toenail.

Jet was trying to turn her face away as the disgusting digit painfully clawed its way up her crushed body, chunks of her gear even getting torn up and cast into the bog bellow. No matter the struggle however she could do nothing as it finally made contact with her face. The smell of a warehouse of overripe cheese began to assault her senses as the crusty nail scraped up and down the poor girls face. The toe nail deciding this spot was in need of more thorough treatment began scratching more fervently.

Jet was in agony, with each scrape her flesh felt like it was going to be torn off but thanks to Holly’s spell it just spread her face out thinner over the ball of the trolls foot. The nail even found its way into Jets mouth dragging and spreading her tongue out to ensure she got a nice taste of this trolls brand of foot stink.

Thankfully after a good while the toe receded back to resting as the troll began to shift to ensure its front got an adequate soak in the mud. Jets world was turned upside down as the feet were facing the other way. She was now facing towards the cave entrance and the cleansing rains were now effectively waterboarding her as they cascaded down, bringing with them a distinctly tainted taste of troll sweat with them. They were also acting as Jets means of salvation though. Dues to the battering her body took thanks to the large toenail parts of her body had shifted, this then allowed water to pass underneath her and slowly but surely she was peeling free albeit still incredibly disfigured.

In fact to look at Jet now you wouldn’t even be able to tell she was even human. Her already long limbs were now cartoonishly so. Her torso and head flattened out to almost the same length and width of the trolls foot. Her once defined features of her face blurred through and her tongue stretched out almost two thirds of her body.

Almost an hour later Jets miserable form finally slid free from the confines of the filthy Trolls foot

111133.content:
Jet slid into the mud as the Troll rested on her stomach. Jet's cartoonishly stretched out form twitched as she attempted to move, glancing over towards where Holly was. The healers eyes lit up, ushering Jet over-

Annoyed that her friend wasn't coming out to help- the stretched out thief slowly wormed her way out of the mud, not having too much strength. She heard movement behind her as the Troll shifted positions, buy Jet just ignored it- desperate to get away.

Suddenly a startled sound came out of the Troll- it's gargled rawr echoed out as it suddenly got up. Jet squirmed it terror as the familer shadow of the trolls foot hovered over her.

The calloused heel slammed down on poor jet- before lifting and slamming down again with harsh grinding. Holly could only watch as the troll stomped, a look of rage and fear in the disgusting creatures face as it tried to obliterate what it possibly thought was a pile of snakes.

Instinct forced Jet to panic as her senses were overloaded. She continuously tried to escape, recieving more and more dirty stomps from the startled troll girl. Eventually- Jet was back stuck to the trolls foot as the now aware creature triumphantly ground it's disgusting foot down.

"A-ah- stay still-" Holly begged on the side lines, watching the troll peel the tattered Jet from her foot for examination.

Out of breath and desperate to avoid more conflict, Jet did exactly as Holly wished without even hearing her. The unlucky thief stayed still as the ogre examined her. The face almost looked human, albiet dirty and sweaty with an impossible underbite for two jagged tusks. The horrible stenche wafted over poor Jet as the Orc snorted around her- smelling the air a bit before grinning triumphantly before opening her mouth.

Jet wasn't prepared as the Troll took a bite.
"AHH- YOU STUPID-" She tried to yell, but nothing was audable as the giant tugged and yanked, much to everyones horror. After being treated as a chewtoy for a bit, the troll spat Jet out with annoyance. Examining her weakened body again for a moment, this time stretching her new toy out a few times with a bored look. Both Holly and Jet hoped the troll would get bored, but the troll instead just dragged Jet uncaringly as it walked back into the mud bath- trailing Jet behind her across the mud.

Jet tried wiggling again, but the troll just slammed her into the mud with it's fist. It was obviously less scared and was trying to find a way to use its prize. With it's ass submerged, the giant grunted as putred bubbled emerged from the swamp. Jet gagged from the smell before feeing the trolls fingers threading around her.

The troll looked with curiousity as it threaded each limb between its fingers- a fleeting curiousity as it watched for a moment before looking up as the rain started to pick up again. It opened its disgusting maw upwards, catching water into its drooling mouth as the hand with Jet flopped down, scooping up mud with jet- slamming it into her slimy armpit.

The only one smiling was the troll as it massaged Jet into the disgusting pit, making happy deep throated gargling sounds as it relaxed. By the time it was finished, Jet was practically dripping from the trolls finger tips with sweat and other disgusting gunk.

Jet weakly looked up at the troll, who looked like she just remembered the thing she caught. Dropping her toy into the bath, the Troll watched- waiting for something to happen.

Everything in Jet was telling her to run as the Troll watched, poking her occasionally.

1112.content:
Jet and Holly raced up the ridge as fast as they could, until they could finally see the entrance to the cave in the distance. Carefully sliding down the muddy slope, the two wet and tired explorers ran headlong into the cave. Jet, being the faster girl, entered the cave first. She smiled as the rain stopped pounding onto her back, but quickly spotted that something was wrong.

A pile of conspicuously placed leaves and sticks was lying out right in the middle of the cave floor. Jet was a master thief, and she could easily tell that those sticks and leaves were serving as a poorly disguised cover-up for a pitfall trap. She smirked at the poorly designed trap, but her smile faded as she heard the sound of pounding footsteps behind her.

Liara had always been a kind girl, and absolutely loved doting on those who were smaller, younger or otherwise weaker than her. When she was younger and unable to leave the kingdom, this had mostly been confined to giantess children, although the occasional visitor from the outside world had also found themselves carefully tended to by the young girl. Though more than one had pointed out how patronising this conduct was, they mostly accepted that she had only good intentions. Now older, she’d gotten over her previous habit of picking people up without warning, but still couldn’t quite help fawning over them. Still, most people she visited accepted her readily enough.

Unknown to the massive girl, she had an audience as she closed in on one of the few mountain passes that allowed passage to the kingdom beyond. Both Jet and Holly looked up in awe as the giantess approached, her bare feet pounding against the ground and generating clouds of dust and mini-earthquakes as she walked. Long red hair framed a youthful looking face, offset against prominent and mature curves, and a simple brown dress covered the pale skin of her torso while leaving the majority of her arms and mile-long legs exposed. Neither of the two adventurers had ever seen a giantess up close like this before, and they were momentarily stunned at the existence of such a massive humanoid, the tip of her head reaching easily fifty feet, if not more, into the air.

Unfortunately for Jet, while Holly continued to be mesmerised by the approaching titan, her own attempt to get a closer look resulted in her shoes slipping on the loose earth of the path, and the next thing she knew her feet went out from under her and she was tumbling down the side of the hill. By this point Liara had come so close that the thunderous sound of her footsteps covered the sounds of Jet’s fall and her calls for help as she crashed down towards the path below.

It was only now that the giantess’s gaze moved to the path, having momentarily forgotten the need to keep an eye out for any tiny visitors. She was surprised and pleased to see Holly standing there, and offered a small smile and a wave as she approached, which was quickly returned by the awe-struck healer, neither of them aware of what was about to occur. Distracted as she was, Liara didn’t pay any attention to her next footfall as her bare sole raised itself high above the unlucky thief.

For Jet the next few seconds happened in slow motion. Despite her best attempts to arrest her momentum, her uncontrolled tumble had carried her out into the middle of the path and left her lying on her back winded and bruised and unable to do anything but scream out as she watched the foot of the massive redhead slowly rise and cast its deep shadow over her defenceless form. “No! Please! You have to see me!” It was pointless of course, even if she’d had enough air in her lungs to scream at full capacity, the distance to Liara’s ears was just too far for the sound to reach. As the massive sole descended there was just enough time for Jet’s adrenaline-filled perceptions to make out the layers of dirt and detritus covering the giantess’s left foot before it crashed down upon her.

To Liara it was a footstep like any other, and to Holly it was just another booming retort and a spray of dust as the titanic woman went to pass her by with one last smile. For Jet, however, it was perhaps the worse pain she had ever experienced. The boulder had been bad of course, and it had lasted for so long that she’d felt like she wanted to die, but if she thought that rock had been heavy then she clearly hadn’t known what heavy really was. While not overweight by any sense of the word, Liara was built on a whole different scale than anything the thief had encountered before, and probably weighed more than the combined weight of every person and building in her home town put together. And now all of that frightful mass was being pushed down on Jet’s squishy body, pancaking her so quickly that the giantess didn’t even feel a thing as Jet was smashed into oblivion beneath the ball of her foot, every nerve in the rubber girl’s body flaring at the sheer agony of it.

It got even worse as Liara moved to take her next step, her other foot rising to allow all of her weight to press down on the left alone, and then worsened further still as the heel of that foot rose as well, the ground beneath actually sinking down several inches from the force of it. By the time the whole sole finally lifted it had left a deep crater behind, filled with the leftover residue of the massive footstep, and already starting to crumble into dust as the earthen walls were shook apart by the continuing vibrations of the departing woman’s thunderous steps. High above, and blissfully oblivious to what she had just done, Liara simply turned back to offer one last wave to Holly over her shoulder, before setting her sights on home and picking up the pace a little for the final stretch.
1121.title: Liara the Crusher

choices: Liara is heading to the baths to clean off after her long journey
Liara is heading to the blacksmith to trade her gathered items for coin
Liara is heading to the nearest eating hall to fill her stomach
11212.content:
Seeing the awe-inspiring giantess offering her one last wave, Holly enthusiastically waved back before allowing her eyes to trail down over the entirety of this massive woman’s retreating form. As her faced turned away her long red hair fanned out behind her on a gust of wind blowing down from the mountains. Slender shoulders sat above prominent breasts, the angle of the path allowing the tiny healer to see the edge of the right breast beyond the gentle slope of Liara’s back. Further down a narrow waist flared into wide hips, the lowest reaches of the redhead’s cheeks peeking out from beneath the hem of her dress as she bounced down the path. Beneath that, long slender legs rose and fell rhythmically, lifting smooth if somewhat dirty soles into the air to slam down on the path again and again. And there, barely visible against the ball of the left foot was…

“Jet!” The wonder that Holly had felt was suddenly replaced with terror as she just barely saw the flattened form of her friend adhered to the foot of the giantess moments before it slammed into the ground once more, raising another cloud of dust and debris. For several crucial seconds she was frozen in shock, just watching as Liara pulled further away, before finally lurching into motion and sprinting after her best friend and her unknowing captor. “Wait! Wait! Please stop!”

If Liara had heard Holly she would have stopped. If she had known what was happening beneath her feet she would probably have cried. The redhead was always accommodating to the smaller races, human or otherwise, and would have spared as much time as needed to settle whatever was on the healer’s mind, but the sound of a human, from behind and at ground level, is little more than the tweeting of a distant bird to a giantess, audible only if specific attention is being paid. So it was that, instead of stopping, Liara actually increased her pace, moving from a sedate walk to a more powerful stride as she closed in on her home town and a chance to rest at last.

“No! Jet!” Even as the giantess began to pull away from her Holly still tried to give chase. No matter how many unfortunate incidents may have occurred over the last week, Jet was still her very best friend in the whole world, and it broke her heart to see her being taken away like this. Worse, she knew at least part of this was her fault, and that there was no way the thief would have gotten stuck like that without the rubberfy curse, though then she may have been killed instead. Regardless of her intentions however, there was simply no way Holly could hope to keep up with Liara’s massive strides, a single step for the redhead carrying her over a distance Holly couldn’t hope to match. Never the fittest person at the best of times, the healer eventually gave up on running, slowing to a more manageable pace and vowing that she’d find a way to save her friend eventually.

Meanwhile, unaware of events outside, Jet was suffering in agony beneath her unaware captor’s left foot. When the massive sole had come down it had compacted her face-first against the ball of the foot and she was now forced to periodically endure the weight of this goddess-like being as she carried her who-knows-where. While it would be true to say that the flesh of Liara’s foot was more giving than the boulder she had been crushed by a week ago, it was entirely evident that the redhead did not frequently wear footwear, if ever, as her soles were well hardened from a lifetime of being slammed into the ground and in many ways pressed down harder than the ground beneath. More significantly, the weight of that boulder couldn’t hold a candle to the weight of this woman.

Any hope that Jet may have had for peeling off the foot was quickly lost as a fresh layer of dirt and grime was caked over her body, each footstep packing in a little bit more to gradually obscure her twisted and tortured body from view beneath the dust and twigs. Even if Holly had someone been able to catch up, it was doubtful she would have been able to see the unfortunate thief at this point, and there was every chance that she’d have concluded her to have fallen off and send Liara on her way. Though unable to see any of this from her position, Jet could feel the unpleasant sensation of the muck spreading across her back, even as the hard stones and brambles beneath tore and scrapped at her clothes, ripping them from her body. And she knew. She knew that if nothing happened to save her soon, she could remain trapped here for a very long time.

Blissfully ignorant to the concerns of either of the humans, Liara didn’t feel even the slightest hint of Jet’s presence as she strode up the checkpoint, exchanging a cheery wave with the guard before stepping through. Reaching the township proper would require going a bit further uphill, over rougher and stonier ground, but that was of no concern to the redhead. She’d tread this path many times before after all, and there was no reason why this time would be any different. Her tiny passenger would receive no mercy as she began her ascent, and by the time Holly reached the checkpoint to speak with the guard and attempt to gain entry, the giantess was long gone.

Built similar to a human township, albeit on a much larger scale, the village of the giantesses had all the usual facilities such a town would offer. Scattered among the various houses were a number of common areas, ranging from communal eating halls to public baths, and various businesses and workshops that catered to the community’s needs, including a library, a blacksmith, and a musician’s tower. Right now though, after being away for so long, Liara had only one destination in mind.

Sore and dirty after a week on the road, Liara wanted nothing more than to hit the baths and finally get clean. It wasn’t that she was obsessed with staying clean or anything, if she had been she would have just taken a bath in a lake or something, observers be damned. Rather, she had simply reached her limit for an allowable amount of grime, well aware that she now had a thin coating of dust across most of her skin, and that her feet in particular were several shades darker than they had been when she set out. As such, she needed to get to the baths as a matter of priority.

Still utterly oblivious to the squishy human who had become a part of the latest coating of her left sole, the redhead strode through the village and exchanged a few pleasant greetings with the other giantesses she met along the way, as well as the handful of smaller folks she saw on the higher walkways that crisscrossed above the streets. The pathways were deliberately positioned to stay out of the road of any gigantic foot traffic, though Liara still had to pay attention less she accidentally bump them with her shoulders or head. Fortunately, the villages’ residents were well use to their tiny visitors by now and while there had been problems in the past, incidents were now unknown.

In no time at all, Liara reached her own home and hurriedly dumped her bag at the door before changing direction and making a beeline for the closest baths. She twisted around on the ball of her left foot as she did so, and had her hearing been better she might have heard Jet’s scream as her body was roughly stretched across the unforgiving flesh. A few more hurried steps brought Liara to her destination, and she took a deep and relaxing breath as she pushed through the curtains and allowed her feet to press down on the warm tiles of the bathhouse, steam from the baths billowing up to surround her as a pleasant heat settled into her tired muscles and bones.

For Jet the rough ground of the village was replaced with the smoother surface of the tiles, but any benefit was easily offset by the rapidly rising heat that made it feel like she was being ironed to the sole. Worse, the increased temperature was causing the pours of Liara’s foot to open, and unleash a fresh torrent of sweat that immediately began to soak into the thief’s defenceless body. The scent of dirt was replaced with the stench of sweat, and the redhead’s weight continued to crush her.

Pleased to see that the bathhouse was mostly empty save for a couple of other giantesses on the far side, Liara wasted no time stripping off her dress and undergarments, before grabbing a bucket and moving to sit down on one of the nearby stools. This provided some slight relief for Jet as the weight pressing down on her was drastically reduced, but she now found herself pressed down into a puddle of water, which was rising up to fill the gaps around her and restricting her breath. Whereas before the sole had lifted and fallen continuously, now it was pressed flat against the tiles, and the tiny thief tried desperately to struggle, less she suffocate beneath this oblivious woman.

Heedless to the dangerous situation beneath her left foot, Liara filled the bucket with water from the nearby tap and then upended it over her own head, shivering slightly as the cooler water ran over her skin before grabbing a nearby wash cloth. The fresh wave pooled around her feet and threatened to drown Jet once and for all, but she was saved at the last moment as her prison rose from the floor and was flipped over the face its owner. Saved from one potential fate that was, only to be plunged into one that may have been even worse as the redhead started to clean her feet.

Having decided to start her wipe down from the bottom and work her way up, Liara didn’t hesitate to drive the momentarily clean cloth into the layers of grime that had accumulated across the ball of her left foot, frowning slightly at the chunks of dirt and bits off greenery that came free and showered down on the tiles below. She knew it had gotten bad down there, but this was frankly even worse than she had expected, and the feeling of it all mixing with her sweat was distinctly less than pleasant. Thankfully a few firm scrubs removed the majority of the detritus, and she was able to move to cleaning the remainder of her foot, scrubbing the cloth along the step and heel, and then driving it between each of her toes to remove the grime that had accumulated there as well. Had she taken a closer look at the cloth in that moment, she may have just barely been able to see Jet’s twisted body stuck to the cloth as she scoured the unlucky thief all over her sole.

Though the immediate threat to her life had been removed, Jet couldn’t help but wonder if death would have been preferable to this torment. She’d gone from being crushed beneath one part of a dirty foot, to being grinded into ever filthy inch of it, an endless torrent of sweat and grime smeared across her face and forced down her throat. Tears came to her eyes, mixing with the rest of the muck surrounding her, and bringing her no mercy as Liara simply switched her attention to her other foot, carrying Jet to the sole she hadn’t yet met and making sure they became well acquainted.

Once she was satisfied that her feet were sufficiently clean, Liara quickly moved to clean her arms, legs, shoulders and torso, rubbing her tiny prisoner over every inch of her body as she hummed a pleasant little tune and revelled in the feeling of all the dust being scrubbed away. By the time she reached her armpits Jet was wishing she could go back to drowning beneath this woman’s feet, unable to do anything to defend herself as her face was scrapped over the sweaty pits and her screams muffled into obscurity by the putrid nectar. A week’s worth of dried moisture was set free by the wet cloth, and it seemed like every last drop of it was pouring into the thief.

Still not done with her unintentional torture, Liara lent forward and lifted her large butt from the stool, bringing the cloth and its passenger around to face the twin moons of her rear before forcing Jet into them face-first. The shortness of her dress meant that most times when she sat on the ground her cheeks would press into the dirt directly, so the redhead took her time thoroughly scrubbing every inch of her derriere, and the cloth had become almost black by the time she pulled it away. She finished by bringing the now thoroughly used fabric up to her chest and wiping off all of the dirt and sweat that had accumulated beneath her breasts and within the depths of her cleavage, plunging the cloth in and out of her cleavage as she made sure to clean every last bit of flesh.

It was only after several minutes of cleaning that Liara finally judged herself fresh enough to enter the baths proper, dumping one last bucket of water over her head and running her fingers through her hair to remove the twigs that had gotten caught in the flowing locks. She scrunched the cloth up in her hands, wringing it out to remove as much of the accumulated grime as possible before dumping it next to her bucket and leaving both for the next person to enter the baths as she rose from her seat and strode towards the main baths, where she planned to join the existing bathers.

Scant seconds later a burning wave of water washed over the trapped thief, her flattened lungs attempting to emit a pained scream as her vulnerable skin was scorched by the sudden assault, only its rubbery nature preventing it from burning through. Liara lifted her foot into the air once more, taking another powerful step forwards and towards her home. As her foot lifted off of the ground and into the air, Jet was paralyzed with fear as she felt her body rise into the air. Defying belief, her body was plastered to the dirty, slightly sweaty sole of Liara’s foot!

Jet’s body flew through the air, engrained into the very pores of Liara’s foot. She tried everything she could to wiggle and shake her body loose, but it was useless. She couldn’t budge at all, and soon found the ground crashing back into her as Liara’s foot pounded into the dirt. Jet mentally cried out in pain as her body was smacked forcefully onto the rocky ground, but her silent pleas went unanswered.

Liara continued walking towards her home, blissfully unaware of the torment she was subjecting Jet to. If she had known, her kind and caring nature would have led her to be horrified at her actions. Regardless, as she didn’t know, she kept walking with a happy smile on her face. She had been out of her city and touring the world for the past week, and she sorely missed her family.

Back on the cliff, Holly watched Liara until she was a long way away. She had never before seen a giantess, and their visage was enrapturing. Unfortunately, her attention had been completely focused on Liara’s face and body, and not the sole of her foot. Jet’s horrible fate had gone completely unnoticed. As Holly turned to a Jet who was no longer there, she wondered what had happened to her best friend.

Meanwhile, the giantess city finally appeared on the horizon. Giantesses lived in what was basically a normal human city, only upscaled to the hundredth degree in order to fit with their massive size. Liara strolled through the city gates, taking note of the tiny door used for normal sized humans to enter and exit the city. She waved to a few tinies, and then walked onto the main street.

Strolling down the smooth paved roads, Liara felt the slightest irritation on the sole of her left foot. She decided to ignore it, as she was almost home. Turning down a few different roads, she reached her home and walked inside. Almost immediately, her mother lunged forward and embraced her daughter in a huge hug.

“Liara! I missed you so much!” Liara’s mother, Lana, bawled. “How was your trip?”

“It was great mom.” Liara smiled. Lana looked a lot like her daughter, only older. Her red hair was a little shorter, and her skin was a little less smooth, but she still retained most of the charm of her younger years. She was only thirty-eight years old after all, and her massive and mature curves proved she still had a lot going for her.

“Tell me about it at dinner. For now, I’ve already prepared the tub for you!” Lana grinned.

“Thanks mom!” Liara strolled into the bathroom, closing the wooden door behind her. She unstrapped her towel and let it fall to the floor. She then stepped into the tub, letting the hot water sooth her spirit. She let out a low sigh of pleasure, and sank up to her neck into the water.

Meanwhile, Jet’s soft skin was practically being flayed by the hot water of the bath. Also, her flat body still needed air to breathe, and her lungs were quickly running out of capacity. She wondered for a brief moment if all her life had just been leading to this moment. Plastered to the foot of a giantess, and drowning in the water of her bathtub.

Just then, Liara lifted her feet out of the water and propped them up on the edge of the tub. Jet mentally shouted for joy, as her life had been spared. She also realized quickly that Liara had dozed off and fallen asleep. Though her body had been battered quite thoroughly, she was still able to finally reform after about twenty minutes. Thankfully, Liara stayed asleep the entire time.

Returning to her normal human shape, Jet carefully balanced on the edge of the tub. She peered around Liara’s left foot, glancing at Liara’s peaceful, happy, slumbering face. As much as the giantess scared her, Jet’s best bet at the moment would be to get help from someone, and as quickly as possible.

That left her with only two options. She could try to get help from Liara, who was lying here, asleep in the bathtub. Or, she could leave the bathroom via the crack under the door, and try to get help from Lana instead. Jet assumed that Lana would be currently cooking dinner in the kitchen, if the conversation she had just barely managed to overhear was correct. That could be a very dangerous situation, but Jet also didn’t know how difficult it would be to wake a sleeping giantess.

What does Jet decide to do?

113.content:
“Well, from what I last heard, Clara might be somewhere in the swamplands down south.” Holly explained. “You know, where all of those alchemists live?”

“Right…I’ve never been, but I know what you’re talking about.” Jet hopped to her feet. “Well, I suppose that there isn’t any time to rest.” Grabbing Holly’s hand, Jet led her best friend out of the village, using their trusty map to guide their way to the southern swamps. They knew the journey would take a few days, at least, and they didn’t want to give Clara a bigger head start than she already had.

The travel was simple at first, and Jet and Holly were almost having an experience one could define as “fun”. The weather was nice, and the roads were well-traveled and easy to follow. Jet and Holly were able to joke and look on the bright side of their situation. They were making great time, and would approach the alchemist swamps in only another day or two.

The trouble started the morning of the third day of travel. Jet’s cursed luck, all thanks to that shattered mirror, kicked in. Jet woke up in total darkness, having no idea where she was. It turned out that, during the night, Holly had rolled over Jet, squashing her flat. Then, the next morning, Holly had unknowingly folded Jet up and packed her into the bag of supplies she carried with her.

When Jet’s body reformed back to normal size, she exploded out of the bag, ripping the bag in half. The contents of the bag, including all of their food, fell onto the dirty, trodden ground. Holly had, of course, apologized quite profusely, but they were still in a particularly sticky situation without any provisions.

That evening, Jet and Holly went out to scour for some food, managing to get the jump on a horde of wild pigs. It didn’t take long for the stampede of pigs to trample Jet underfoot, squashing her onto the ground. Her own partner did the same moments later, desperately trying to catch a pig before they all escape. Jet had stuck to her boot, and was dragged along the ground behind her for the better part of half an hour.

Jet had insisted on sleeping away from Holly that night to avoid another accident. Unfortunately, Holly was stirred awake by her growling belly, and she fumbled blindly around their camp looking for food. She had stumbled into Jet, accidentally squashing her face. In her drowsy, craving brain, Holly had confused Jet for some doughy bread. Jet woke up with half of her head crammed into Holly’s mouth, and it had taken all of her strength to shove Holly away.

Horrible accidents plagued the remaining two days of the trip, not in the least limited to Holly stepping on Jet, sitting on Jet, leaving Jet behind, and unknowingly getting Jet stuck to various parts of her body or clothing. Nature itself was also cruel to Jet. She was flattened and blow for miles by the wind, trapped in quicksand, and struck by lightning. She would have most likely died without Holly’s healing magic.

Finally, the weary duo entered the alchemist swamps, and a large building came into view. Not really having any other plan, Holly and Jet pushed through the doors and stepped into the strange building. It was a place like nothing they had ever seen. Alchemists bustled left and right, running all over the place. Chemicals and magic spell books were everywhere the eye could see. Complex machinery lined the walls, and boggled their minds. Jet and Holly were reeling, when a voice shook them from their thoughts.

“Excuse me. May I help you?” A kind voice asked, Jet and Holly turned around towards the source of the voice. A girl in her twenties stood behind them, and she was dressed in a tight brown coat and miniskirt. Her chocolate colored hair flowed down past her shoulders, but was pushed out of her face by two cute hairpins. She was wearing glasses that seemed to really accentuate her piercing, hazel eyes.

“Oh…uh…” Holly stumbled over her words.

“We’re…explorers.” Jet ad-libbed. “And we’re looking for someone by the name of Clara. Do you know her?”

“Hm…I can’t say that I do.” The alchemist rubbed her chin thoughtfully. “I’m sorry. If she’s in the swamplands, there are many places that she may be hiding.”

“Right. Makes sense.” Jet sighed, feeling defeated.

“But, I certainly wouldn’t be opposed to helping. My name is Dahlia.” Dahlia pushed her glasses up and smiled cutely. “What might you need?”

“Food.” Holly admitted, rather bluntly. Jet was surprised. “And a place to sleep.”

“Certainly. We have all sorts of delicious food here at the School of Alchemy! Right this way.” Dahlia took Holly’s hand and began leading her down one of the various corridors. Holly looked over her shoulder at Jet, who was still not moving.

“Are you coming Jet?” She inquired. Jet waved her hand at her.

“In a minute.” Jet assured her. A few moments later, Dahlia and Holly disappeared from Jet’s view. Jet was far too enraptured by the School of Alchemy to care about food at the moment.
